tweets.text: Alongside our ambition to plant up to 2 million trees within the River Aire catchment, @EnvAgencyYNE and @NT_TheNorth have been working with landowners near Malham to deliver natural flood management as part of Leeds FAS (1/2)
In a nutshell, another example of @DefraGovUK and the @EnvAgency making it easier to pollute and harm the environment. Can't wait to see what the Environment Bill looks like. https://t.co/RgFEfsANPa
@suesustainable @driverfarms1 @realJohnKempf @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency So what if you do everything and the motorway floods your field

@TheRythreArms @EnvAgencyYNE @johncurtinEA @JamesBevanEA @OliverHarmarEA Thanks @TheRythreArms üëçüèº the teams have all worked some very long hours and your feedback and support are always valued. Levels subsiding now but we are closely monitoring. When the time comes we will demob our pumps, clean them and service them and get them ready to go again üëçüèº
@agricontract @suesustainable @realJohnKempf @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency I don‚Äôt think soil is soluble otherwise it would need a chemical process to settle out in rivers? Happy to be corrected

@suesustainable @driverfarms1 @realJohnKempf @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency Things can be done to slow soil erosion at farm level but soil is soluble and always will be that‚Äôs why the country is the shape it is 
To think it can be stopped completely is. Delusional and a EA pipe dream

If the the @EnvAgency CEO @JamesBevanEA is not aware that sewage is discharged into chalk streams what chance have we got. The @RiverChess has had 79 sewage discharges over a 16 month period between 24 Sept 2019 and 25th Jan 2021.
Our interactive story map shows you how to access & use @EnvAgency survey #opendata #LIDAR #opendefra https://t.co/NSpdCYTxGv @EsriStoryMaps https://t.co/FWnC7uujXW

@nocotu @johnnyrich @Jennife15046404 @KwasiKwarteng @The_ONR @EnvAgency @theCCCuk Yes, given EDF's experiences at Olkiluoto, Flamanville & Hinkley C, EDF know Sizewell C will be overbudget & delivered late (if at all!)...the question is, why aren't the UK govt acknowledging this & are prepared to force UK bill/taxpayers to subsidise French state-owned EDF?

@johnnyrich @SayNo2SizewellC @Jennife15046404 @KwasiKwarteng @The_ONR @EnvAgency @theCCCuk I don‚Äôt think it is a case of rebuilding EDF - staving off bankruptcy may be more appropriate. If EDF are that good - why do they require the UK Govt to underwrite the cost and programme risk?? Simple answer is they know it will be later and massively over cost.

urls.description: LATEST INFORMATION ON FLOODING IN MALTON, NORTON AND OLD MALTON Information updated 10:00, 30 January 2021 A flood warning remains in place for the River Derwent at Old Malton. The Environment Agency has now removed the flood alerts for Mill Beck at Welham Road, Norton and the River Derwent at No

tweets.text: Flood water update: The overall position in Malton, Norton and Old Malton remains stable and is gradually improving, but response agencies remain on the ground and will continue to monitor the situation carefully.
